#summary Various ways to assemble the RCShield.

As the RCShield comes as 2 identical boards (before soldering the components), it can be assembled in various ways to better suit the user requirements in terms of channels.<br>

<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_1Ch.jpg" width="350"><a>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_2Ch.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_2Ch.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
One channel: through one potentiometer: plus, minus. <br>
Two channels through a joystick: up, down, left, right.<br><br><br>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_3Ch.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_3Ch.jpg" width="350"><a>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_4Ch.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_4Ch.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
Three channel: through one joystick and one potentiometer: up, down, left, right, plus, minus. <br>
Four channels through two joysticks: up, down, left, right, throttle-up, throttle-down, yaw-clockwise, yaw-counter.<br><br><br>
<a href="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_5Ch.jpg">
<img src="http://ardurct.googlecode.com/svn/images/RCShield_5Ch.jpg" width="350"><a><br>
Five channels through two joysticks and one potentiometer: up, down, left, right, throttle-up, throttle-down, yaw-clockwise, yaw-counter, plus, minus.<br>
